intro: Symplocos odoratissima var. odoratissima, commonly known as the fragrant waxleaf. It is a deciduous shrub native to Southeast Asia, characterized by its glossy, aromatic leaves and small, white flowers. The plant produces small, edible berries that are typically consumed by birds and other wildlife. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Its aromatic foliage makes it a popular ornamental plant in horticulture.
